sen.j: 近衛 稙家（このえ たねいえ、文亀3年（1503年） - 永禄9年7月10日 (旧暦)（1566年7月26日））は、戦国時代 (日本)の公家・関白。
sen.e: Taneie KONOE (1503 to July 26, 1566) was a court noble who served as Kanpaku (Chief Adviser to the Emperor) during the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).
Taneie KONOE (1503 to July 26, 1566) was a court noble who served as Kanpaku (Chief Adviser to the Emperor) during the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).
Taneie KONOE (1503 to August 5, 1566) was a court noble who served as Kanpaku (Chief Adviser to the Emperor) during the Sengoku period (Period of Warring States).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正、Sengoku periodとしました。

sen.j: 父は近衛尚通。
sen.e: His father was Hisamichi KONOE.
His father was Hisamichi KONOE.
His father was Hisamichi KONOE.

sen.j: 母は徳大寺実敦の娘維子。
sen.e: His mother was Fusako TOKUDAIJI, Saneatsu TOKUDAIJI's daughter.
sen.cmt: 徳大寺実敦 (徳大寺実淳) →Saneatsu TOKUDAIJI[実敦→実淳の誤りと思われる]
sen.e: His mother was Fusako TOKUDAIJI, Saneatsu TOKUDAIJI's daughter.
His mother was Fusako TOKUDAIJI, Saneatsu TOKUDAIJI's daughter.

sen.j: 妻は久我通言の娘慶子。
sen.e: His wife was Keiko KOGA, Michinobu KOGA's daughter.
sen.cmt: (久我) 慶子→Keiko KOGA[慶子の読みが不明です]
sen.e: His wife was Keiko KOGA, Michinobu KOGA's daughter.
His wife was Keiko KOGA, Michinobu KOGA's daughter.

sen.j: 妹の慶寿院は室町幕府第12代将軍足利義晴室として室町幕府第13代将軍足利義輝・第15代将軍足利義昭兄弟を生んだ。
sen.e: His sister, Keijuin, was the officially recognized wife of Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA, the 12th shogun of the Muromachi Government, and gave birth to Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA, the 13th shogun, and Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, the 15th shogun.

His sister, Keijuin, was the officially recognized wife of Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA, the 12th shogun of the Muromachi Government, and gave birth to Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA, the 13th shogun, and Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, the 15th shogun.

His sister, Keijuin, was the officially recognized wife of Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA, the 12th shogun of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and gave birth to Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA, the 13th shogun, and Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, the 15th shogun.
sen.cmt: Muromachi Government→Muromachi bakufuとし、初出のためbakufuの補足追加

sen.j: 子に関白太政大臣近衛前久、娘（足利義輝室）、娘（朝倉義景側室）、他。
sen.e: His children included Sakihisa KONOE, who served as Daijo Daijin (Grand Minister of State), a daughter (Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA's wife) and another daughter (Yoshikage ASAKURA's concubine).
His children included Sakihisa KONOE, who served as Daijo Daijin (Grand Minister of State), a daughter (Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA's wife) and another daughter (Yoshikage ASAKURA's concubine).
His children included Sakihisa KONOE, who served as Daijo Daijin (Grand Minister of State), a daughter (Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA's wife) and another daughter (Yoshikage ASAKURA's concubine).

sen.j: 斎藤正義は庶子といわれる。
sen.e: Masayoshi SAITO is believed to have been his child born out of wedlock.
Masayoshi SAITO is believed to have been his child born out of wedlock.
Masayoshi SAITO is believed to have been his child born out of wedlock.

sen.j: 経歴
sen.e: Career
Career
Career

sen.j: 永正11年（1514年） 元服して従三位に叙せられた。
sen.e: In 1514, Taneie celebrated his coming-of-age and was awarded the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
In 1514, Taneie celebrated his coming-of-age and was awarded the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
1514: Taneie celebrated his coming-of-age and was awarded the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 大永3年（1523年） 右大臣就任。
sen.e: In 1523, was appointed as Udaijin (Minister of the Right).
In 1523, was appointed as Udaijin (Minister of the Right).
1523: He was appointed as Udaijin (Minister of the Right).
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、"He"追加

sen.j: 大永5年（1525年） 関白・藤原氏長者。
sen.e: In 1525, was appointed as Kanpaku (Chief Adviser to the Emperor) and Head of the Fujiwara clan.
In 1525, was appointed as Kanpaku (Chief Adviser to the Emperor) and Head of the Fujiwara clan.
1525: He was appointed as Kanpaku and Head of the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、"He"追加、Kanpaku→既出のため補足削除

sen.j: 享禄元年（1528年） 左大臣就任。
sen.e: In 1528, was appointed as Sadaijin (Minister of the Left).
In 1528, was appointed as Sadaijin (Minister of the Left).
1528: He was appointed as Sadaijin (Minister of the Left).
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、"He"追加

sen.j: 天文 (元号)2年（1533年） 関白・氏長者辞任。
sen.e: In 1533, resigned as Kanpaku and Head of the Fujiwara clan.
In 1533, resigned as Kanpaku and Head of the Fujiwara clan.
1533: Resigned as Kanpaku and Head of the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 天文4年（1535年） 准三宮宣下を受け、左大臣を辞任。
sen.e: In 1535, was awarded the rank of Jusangu (an honorary rank next to Emperor, Empress Dowager and Empress) by the Emperor and resigned the position of Sadaijin (Minister of the Left).
In 1535, was awarded the rank of Jusangu (an honorary rank next to Emperor, Empress Dowager and Empress) by the Emperor and resigned the position of Sadaijin (Minister of the Left).
1535: He was awarded the rank of Jusangu (an honorary rank next to Emperor, Empress Dowager and Empress) by the Emperor and resigned the position of Sadaijin (Minister of the Left).
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、"He"追加

sen.j: 天文5年（1536年） 関白・氏長者再任。
sen.e: In 1536, was reappointed as Kanpaku and Head of the Fujiwara clan.
In 1536, was reappointed as Kanpaku and Head of the Fujiwara clan.
1536: He was reappointed as Kanpaku and Head of the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、"He"追加

sen.j: 天文6年（1537年） 太政大臣就任。
sen.e: In 1537, was appointed as Daijo Daijin (Grand Minister of State).
In 1537, was appointed as Daijo Daijin (Grand Minister of State).
1537: He was appointed as Daijo Daijin.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、"He"追加、Daijo Daijin→既出のため補足削除

sen.j: 天文10年（1541年） 太政大臣辞任。
sen.e: In 1541, resigned as Daijo Daijin.
In 1541, resigned as Daijo Daijin.
1541: Resigned as Daijo Daijin.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 天文11年（1542年） 関白を辞任。
sen.e: 1542: Resigned as Kanpaku.
sen.cmt: 訳がぬけているため訳出しました。

sen.j: 足利義昭を猶子とする。
sen.e: He had a fictional father-son relationship with Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA.
He had a fictional father-son relationship with Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA.
He had a fictional father-son relationship with Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA.
